result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael T Hunter

records.addlTxt:
9:31 AM Defendant Michael T Hunter in court, in custody.  Attorney Alexander J. Kostal in court for Michael T Hunter.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  State has filed a motion to adjourn the trial.  State is in Chapter 950 compliance.  State makes further comment on the adjournment request.  State does not have the DNA results back from the lab.  State makes further record.  Defense does wish to have the DNA results.  Defense comments.  BTC: Jury trial adjourned.  Defense does have a trial in Milwaukee on the week given in court.  The court has no other days to give.  The court has multiple DST's filed on all days the court is available for trial from now until the end of the year.  The court also has a DST on the same day this would be scheduled.  BTC: The court is leaving the trial scheduled for the date given in court.  If the trial in Milwaukee proceeds the court will address that at that time.  State makes further record of the SANE exam defense mentioned.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 08:30 am.

9:32 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael T Hunter in court.  Attorney Alexander J. Kostal in court for Michael T Hunter. Court Reporter:  Carmen Howard. Defense is still receiving discovery.  Defense is asking to set a trial based on the trial calendar.  State confirms they are still waiting for discovery.  All Motions in Limine, Witness lists, Proposed Jury Instructions and changes to the Substantive Jury Instructions are due 48  hours before the Final Pretrial.  Parties are to check for witness availability for this scheduled trial date and inform the Court of any problems. July 29 is the drop dead date for any suppression motions, evidentiary motions, daubert motions.. etc.  July 15 is the drop dead date for any issues regarding any missing discovery that would prohibit either party from filing any motions.  Parties to submit a letter asking for an extension on filing motions.
Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: State's NOI to Intro Recorded Statements
Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

1:37 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelsey L. Blumenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael T Hunter appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gregory A Holdahl appeared by video for Michael T Hunter. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Initial appearance on April 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
